title: Love this app
text: I came across this app a while ago but they aren‚Äôt in Denver yet so I‚Äôve been eager to use it elsewhere. I‚Äôm on a trip in Paris and remembered it‚Äôs here so I used it! It was really fun to get some discounted treats from a bakery. This app is incredible for reducing food waste and offering cheaper prices for food that was going to get thrown away anyway!

title: Great idea, but poorly executed
text: After hearing about this app I thought I‚Äôd give it a try. After working at a restaurant I‚Äôve always thought something like this would be a great way to get cheap food and conserve waste, but upon arriving at the restaurant to pick up my order they seemed surprised, and I had to explain what the app was to the employee. I then received a single slice of pizza for my ‚Äúsurprise bag.‚Äù Super disappointed, and will definitely avoid wasting my money in the future by just ordering directly from restaurants to ensure that I get my moneys worth.

title: Good in theory
text: I‚Äôm very annoyed because every time I order food, the order gets cancelled an hour before because there ‚Äúisn‚Äôt enough surplus food‚Äù. I don‚Äôt think they weed out their partners enough and, for example, sushi shop , despite the orders I‚Äôve placed , have NEVER had my order available. Canceled each time.

title: Gratitude üôèüèº
text:
I think this app is very helpful and smart for businesses, individuals, and the environment.  

I‚Äôm very grateful to have more healthy food options, especially when low on supplies, in between pay periods/gigs, or just wanting to try something different without feeling like I‚Äôm taking a true financial risk. üôèüèº

title: Great food to go. Great value.
text: The Too Good To Go website was suggested by a brother of mine. Signed up this morning, selecting a bakery as my first trial run, good a good assortment of muffins, breads, and pastries. Too much to eat in one sitting, but a great value. Feels almost as if I were taking advantage of them, but though it is not fresh out of the oven, the food is still tasty and edible.

title: Is it a joke?
text: I agree this app is about not letting food get wasted and instead give it away for a cheaper price. But then who is controlling the quality and quantity of food that‚Äôs sold. This is gap or a complete miss on the part of this franchise. I felt cheated. I paid almost 15$ for a few green leaves they called a salad and few strands of a tasteless pasta (both of which seemed like leftovers from someone‚Äôs plate), from this place called Il Pescatore Italian Restaurant & Bar in Seattle to the extent that I felt I might get sick eating it. Uninstalled the app that very minute. Never returning to this app.

title: Fantastic
text:
Really love this app. It‚Äôll only get better with age hopefully! Good range and good food consistently from so many places. 

Also - both limiting waste of food and supplying fairly priced meals? A++++++ 

Only think I‚Äôd watch out for is when they become prominent which they obviously will. Larger company = price gouging and stupid greed.

title: Download this app!!!
text:
The opportunity to have a hot meal at an affordable price, contribute to no-waste, love the environment, and support local is all in THIS APP.

Thank you for your collaboration, it IS the new competition. I heard of this app on How I Built this with Guy Raz and tried out it the same week. 10/10 recommend to anyone 18+ older and younger with parental guidance.

title: The service is good, but the push advertising isnt
text:
I like the Too Good To Go service.  No complaints there. 

Sadly, though, if you enable push notifications to get order reminders you also get advertising alerts on a regular basis. 

With no way to turn off the advertising it becomes a constant nagging - bad enough that I started to turn away when I considered using TGTG because it felt like giving in to their heavy handed tactics. üòø

title: Nothing like what they make it seem.
text: This is the first review for an app I have ever written. For my first time using this app, I wasn‚Äôt sure what to expect - but this company made it sound like for only a few dollars, you would receive a bag ‚Äúfull‚Äù of food. I tried a bakery for my first bag. I paid $5 & what I received was 3 cupcakes. Each cupcake on the menu is only $2. TooGoodToGo places a ‚Äúfull price‚Äù & then a ‚Äúdiscounted price‚Äù. To think that I could have paid $18 to only receive 3 cupcakes feels extremely deceitful. I doubt I will ever try this app again.

title: An app for positive change!
text: Finally an app that I feel is totally dedicated to positive change!  Fight food waste, makes food more affordable, and helps businesses!  Everyone wins!  I downloaded this on a whim and I have to say, it‚Äôs a great app!  Slick interface, easy to use, and based off your location, it‚Äôs the perfect app!

title: Great idea, but should have been able to search before I downloaded the app
text: Downloaded the app eagerly just to see there is no applicable place within hundreds of miles from me. I tried to find this information out prior to downloading the app and I was unsuccessful. Disappointing to go through the effort of downloading an app for this result.

title: Food from supermarkets are way past expiration date
text: It was fun in the beginning but now I am getting food 5+ months expired. Meet sticks and kids pasta meals I don‚Äôt feel comfortable giving my child. Also multiple bad items that they were not able to sell. Disappointed

title: This my new favorite app
text: The idea is genius and the execution is perfect. The amount of food you get for the money is unbelievable and I love being introduced to so many small businesses I would otherwise never find or think to try. Saving food from being wasted is just the icing on the cake.

title: Bring back the list view!
text: The app is great but the latest update nixed the list view under the browse button. Bring it back! Swiping left is so much more time consuming and there‚Äôs no rhyme or reason to the order in which the restaurants show up.

title: Major issues
text: I love the idea of this app and what it‚Äôs doing, but the app itself is not made well. When I first downloaded it everything was fine and I just wanted to see what it was all about. But that only lasted about 5 minutes before it crashed. Now it won‚Äôt even stay open long enough to load before crashing again. I‚Äôve even tried removing and redownloading it. Once I get signed in it crashes again...looking forward to this being fixed and their area being expanded, but for now I‚Äôm disappointed, such a great idea...

title: Mediocre
text: I love the idea of minimizing food waste and donating to a good charity. Great idea! I tried it, paid my $5 at Panera and got a few nice little things - which is fine. However, the shelves were still full at 9:00 at night. They would have had to be more generous in order for me to do this again. It was suggested that customers bring a bag to carry items home. I found really no need for that‚Ä¶everything fit easily in the small brown sack that was provided.

title: Genius
text: Such a great idea to eliminate food waste little by little. I‚Äôve only had good experiences on this app with restaurants. It‚Äôs so cheap and the quantity of food is incredible! I‚Äôve gotten two small 12‚Äù pizzas for $4 total. Picked it up for dinner and had enough food for four days! Can‚Äôt recommend this app enough.

title: Great app for good food and good price
text: We have been using this app for about a week.  Tried three or four different places so far.  The food has all been amazing!!! We are new to the area.  This gives an idea about where to go eat.  Also, we are helping eliminating waste.  All for good cause!!! This is a great idea.

title: Great App! Need ability to note food allergies
text: I love this app and have already used it twice in my first week downloading it! I would love to be able to note that I have a nut allergy so the shop makes sure to not include that in my order. I look forward to more restaurants in my local area start to use this service and cause less waste!

title: So 2 Good!
text:
New to Portland and was introduced to the app by a friend. What a brilliant idea. We appreciate the kindness of the organizations involved and the smart people that designed this process. 

Through the 2 Good 2 Go community we have been introduced to some new favorites in town. 

Easy to use - highly recommend!

title: Too many bots
text:
All these greedy nerds in SF bay area take up all the good stuff by using bots. You could be refreshing every minute, and stuff will be gone before it even shows up. Toogoodtogo developers please stop bots. Maybe limit how many times a user can claim from a store? 
Also I have notifications turned on and have never received a single notification about a new bag available.

title: Beginners luck!
text: I walked into a Coffee Bean and Tea leaf not knowing what to expect, but I was pleasantly surprised! I got six bags of food probably worth about $75 bucks because their computer system was broken and they could only reserve one bag when they had more. So thankful! Multiple sandwiches and pastries! Thank you for this service!

title: Use at discretion - not a meal ticket
text:
I‚Äôve only used the app a handful of times before realizing it‚Äôs setbacks. 

This app needs better management for the stores that sell out. They shouldn‚Äôt list themselves if they have 0 inventory and the store should also notify the customer beforehand if they do‚Ä¶. 

Although it‚Äôs a great concept, there are times where I‚Äôve gone to the store and they‚Äôre closed because they sell out or the items listed are not what is advertised (i.e: a store near me said they had grocery AND pastries, but the lady was walking around and said her groceries were too fresh so she doubled up on her pastries‚Ä¶ which were cheaper than what I had paid for. Waste of $15 in my opinion). 

Like the saying goes.. fool me once, shame on me. Fool me twice.. shame on you.

title: Love the concept. Hate the execution on part of the restaurants
text:
I was so pumped to use this service and count it as a little treat and means of keeping something from getting wasted. 
I‚Äôve gotten 2 surprise bags, and I think I‚Äôve I honestly feel ripped off both times. 
A hot coffee at 8 pm and 3 measly croissants weren‚Äôt even worth the trip if they were free. The first experience was better, but nothing close to my expectation. I received 3 cranberry muffins. No variety. No great deal. Just 3 cranberry muffins. No thanks.

title: Love to rescue food
text:
We have rescue dogs and love the idea of rescuing. Rescuing food is a great way to try out some
Neighborhood restaurants without losing much money. It feels good to order from these restaurants knowing that they participate in reducing waste. We have found our favorite pizzeria and favorite dessert place through this app.

title: Notification settings are pointless
text: I set my notifications to on and saved a couple of favorites to my list but don‚Äôt get notified when those restaurants have pickups available? Seems like that would be a logical setting. Makes it really hard to know when to take a peek at the app.  Haven‚Äôt even gotten a chance to grab a pickup because I keep missing them all.

title: Some venders can improve the quality of their food
text: While I am enjoying many deals this app offers, I really hope to see more variety of restaurants join this app! Not just all the bakeries and donut shops. Those pastries and donuts are so unhealthy for us!!! I would lie to see more healthy food restaurants join the chain. That‚Äôs my biggest wish!

title: Excited To Try - One Thing That Might Not Work
text:
I LOVE this concept and just signed up for my first bag. Though I would love to use this more, I'm vegetarian so it severely limits what I can get. I wish there was a 'vegetarian bag' choice.  
  
I'll see how this goes but I can definitely see this being a reason I don't continue to use the all or use it frequently.

title: Store was closed!
text: After driving 20 minutes to pick up an order scheduled between 5-6pm, arrived at 5:10 pm to find out the market was closed at 4 pm. Spoke with worker from another store (who came outside to help me) who said that everyone had left at 4 pm.  This is unacceptable, waste of my time and gas.  They should not participate if going to close!

title: Not for everyone
text: The app itself seems to work fine. One place I wanted to try was always sold out instantly no matter how I tried - maybe find a way to make that more fair. The one place I did try gave a decent amount of food but it was maybe a step above eating out of the dumpster. So not for everyone but I suppose if you're very young and just need to survive, it will be helpful.

title: Chicagoans must try this
text: Today was my first time using the app, and I give it 4 starts for the idea and execution. The app itself can‚Äôt be to blame if the food isn‚Äôt great, but on my first day I‚Äôve picked up two orders and was quite pleased. Ok. The tacos in one were a bit cold, but again, that‚Äôs not the apps fault. I got three big carnitas tacos, with salsas and rice and beans for $3.99, what‚Äôs not to like?

title: Great concept!
text: Love it!  Wish the app notifications could be set for specific locations when they post availability.  Also, users should be able to view the review comments/photos to get a better idea what has been in previous bags.

title: Great deal
text:
Think of this is going to the half-price bread rack at the back of your supermarket‚Ä¶ reworked for the Internet age!

The only negative is traffic‚Ä¶ So my suggestion is‚Ä¶ If the place you‚Äôre picking up from offers more than one bag that day‚Ä¶ Purchase at least two‚Ä¶ to justify the drive‚Ä¶

title: Good idea, bad implementation‚Ä¶
text: This app could be really good, if it worked as it says so on the tin. There are no resultants within 100 miles of me that are participating. So this app is completely useless to me and anyone in central Florida.  I thought because I saw and video ads for it that they might be a little more spread out and have a wider range of coverage, I thought wrong. I‚Äôll check back in a few months to see if this has changed‚Ä¶. I hope it does.

title: What an amazing idea!
text: I absolutely love everything about this app concept and I pray a lot more restaurants in la join in on this! The food being saved, restaurants stills making their deserved money and us getting our delicious mystery boxes! It‚Äôs just the best!! The prices make everything absolutely spectacular

title: Bloody Scam
text:
These guys keep your money if you don‚Äôt pick up your goodies. Total scam. 
They rake in the bucks and keep it pretending that their objective is to save food from going to waste, instead they just wait fir the next sucker to sign up and have his money fleeced. Should be banned for their business practice.

title: One of my favorite apps
text: Too good to go, or 2G2G as my family calls it, is an awesome app. It allows you to try so many small businesses that you would‚Äôve never had before and you‚Äôre getting great bang for your buck! Saving waste while saving money. Nothing better!

title: Awesome app
text: I just discovered this app through a friend and I love it! The idea of this app is wonderful both for the store owners and for the customers. I can‚Äôt wait until more businesses sign up, especially restaurants. Pastries and desserts are great, but healthy options would definitely be welcome, as well.

title: Why did you make me download?
text: I live in an area that is quite populous but geographically remote. That means it‚Äôs a toss up on whether there would be anyone here participating. But instead of letting me look on the website the site days ‚Äúdownload and see‚Äù so it takes me three minutes and a walk through and signing up for an account for them to tell me there‚Äôs no one in my area. Waste of my time to get my email address so now I‚Äôm assuming they‚Äôll spam me about a product I can‚Äôt even use. Thanks folks.

title: This is a wonderful idea!
text: Alright. So I‚Äôm here to give it a good review because I think the concept is WONDERFUL. Unfortunately, I live in Georgia, and there‚Äôs no where even a little bit in my vicinity that‚Äôs taking advantage of this. Would love it I could use the app, and plan on it once I‚Äôm near somewhere that‚Äôs using this.

title: Terrible app
text: Not useful in my area. The only business that‚Äôs available or participating with the app a small chain coffee shop. It‚Äôs not worth it. I would have to drive out 2 hrs away to find options. Is this a new app? Or how long have you guys existed? Northern California like Sonoma county isn‚Äôt that far from San Francisco but yet I have to drive south for an hr to get something for $3.99. And peets coffee is only offering things like pastry‚Äôs. And it‚Äôs like getting 4 donuts for $4. This is so ridiculous. You don‚Äôt actually get leftovers from peets.

title: Best idea to save on food waste yet!
text: With food waste being such a problem in the US I quickly jumped on to this app. The prices and low and the food is plentiful (and not trashed). This is also right on time for my financial situation right now too. Helping me get meals when I need to pinch Pennie‚Äôs the most!

title: Great, but could use an improvement
text: I would really like to be able to receive push notifications from the app when my favorited restaurants post bags they have available for the day. Sometimes I forget to check at the usual time and miss a bag I would‚Äôve purchased had I been notified.

title: More transparency!
text: Don‚Äôt force people to download the app before they find out what the deal is, be up front about it from the beginning! They are ‚Äúsurprise‚Äù bags of food for a discount. I highly doubt these are cutting down on any food waste. How do they know that restaurants aren‚Äôt just buying the cheapest ingredients possible to throw in there and make more money, pretending like it‚Äôs this discounted deal? Seems like yet another brand getting heaps of attention for their ‚Äúfeel good‚Äù concept when no one stops to think about the reality of what‚Äôs actually happening.

title: Genius!
text: This is genius! The app is amazing, so easy to use, and it is an incredible deal!!!! For $9 spent at two locations I got an apple, orange, banana, pastry, 2 slices of pizza, taro latte, black tea latte with boba, and a mango slush. Absolutely incredible!! Thank you for helping stop food waste! And I love exploring new spots in my neighborhood. I will definitely be using this often! ‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è

title: Greenwashing.
text: I had used the app three times, two of the three restaurant give small amounts of food and mostly side dishes, but I didn‚Äôt mean. However, I decided to delete the app because I brought an order where the pick up window was 11 - 3 yet the pick up time was 3 - 4 when I couldn‚Äôt make it. I wasn‚Äôt refund, even though this was the first time. Customer service was just an automated email, disheartening. Like other complaints restaurants always sold out no matter what time I checked.

title: Too Good To Notify
text: This is a great app that saves lots of money and waste, but a crucial/annoying part of it is that you have to constantly check back instead of being able to receive notifications on certain stores, or even your favourites, so they sell out in minutes. Also the search area could be a little more refined

title: Great concept!
text: Wish the search functionality was a little more refined, though...being able to sort of alphabetical order, collection time, etc would make this app even better. But thank you for creating this.

title: I wish there was a notification
text: Great app, but I wish there was a notification for restaurants when they put up the deal. I always have to open the app to check the deals, and by the time I open most of the deals are gone :(
